page.title: 05THE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: There is only one{shop}in Llannefydd. It has in stock a variety of foods and household goods as well as sweets, tobacco and stationary.In the shop there is a{Post Office}and outside there is a petrol pump.The shop is open from 8am till 5.30pm on four days a week and from 9am till 1pm pm on Thursday and Saturday.Thursdays and Saturdays are the busiest days.On Thursdays Mr Salusbury delivers orders to the local farms, a journey of 40km. At 6.30am the newspapers arrive,70 in all,and the most popular is the Daily Post.Fresh bread is delivered from Denbigh on four days a week and the shop sells 40 loaves a day on average. The other goods come from Rhyl and Welshpool.The Salusbury family have kept the shop for three generations (since 1903).Mr & Mrs Salusbury only have a holiday on bank holidays.
